Installation¶

From repository¶

Using Pip¶

  1. Open the terminal.

  2. Navigate to the desired empty directory.

  3. Clone the GitHub repository:

    $ git clone https://github.com/a-beduc/formation_project_13.git
$ cd formation_project_13

  4. create a virtual environment:

    $ python -m venv .venv

  5. activate the virtual environment:

    Linux / MacOS,

    $ source .venv/bin/activate

    or Windows.

    $ .venv\Scripts\activate

  6. Install dependencies:

    Only necessary,

    $ pip install -r requirements.txt

    or with dev tools.

    $ pip install -r requirements.dev.txt

Using Uv¶

Step 1-3 are similar than with pip.

  1. Open the terminal.

  2. Navigate to the desired empty directory.

  3. Clone the GitHub repository:

    $ git clone https://github.com/a-beduc/formation_project_13.git
$ cd formation_project_13

  4. Install uv, guide: https://docs.astral.sh/uv/getting-started/installation/

  5. Install dependencies

    Only necessary,

    $ uv sync --no-dev

    or with dev tools.

    $ uv sync

From image¶

With embedded demo database¶

  1. Copy the file docker-compose.demo.yaml from the repository: https://github.com/a-beduc/formation_project_13

  2. Install Docker Desktop according to your OS: https://docs.docker.com/get-started/get-docker/

With clean database and volume¶

The first run should populate the volume with a database containing only a superuser.

  1. Copy the file docker-compose.yaml from the repository: https://github.com/a-beduc/formation_project_13

  2. Install Docker Desktop according to your OS: https://docs.docker.com/get-started/get-docker/

  3. Verify that docker is running.

  4. Create a new empty volume named empty-volume:

    $ docker volume create empty-volume
